newsitem.title: GERMANY: Bundesbank sets repo tender at fixed 3 percent.
newsitem.headline: Bundesbank sets repo tender at fixed 3 percent.

text.p: The Bundesbank said on Tuesday it was setting a tender for 14-day securities repurchase funds, offering banks liquidity at a fixed rate of 3.00 percent.
A 75.0 billion-mark repo pact expires on Wednesday. The repo rate has been fixed at 3.00 percent since late August.
The funds will be credited to accounts tomorrow, Wednesday, and the securities will be repurchased on January 29, the Bundesbank said.
